sect2.title: The Toolbar
sect2.para: The &application; toolbar provides easy access to functions used for playing tracks. From here it is possible to Play the currently selected track, Skip to a previous or next track, Pause a playing track, or select 'shuffle' play.
It also shows the volume control, which is described later.

note.para: The layout of the toolbar can be customized, see

sect2.title: The Side Pane
sect2.para:
The side pane is where you can access your music library and your groups . The side pane allows access to the following:
The &application; library, where all of the imported songs will appear.
Any groups that have been created to organize the library contents.

sect3.title: Playing Songs/Albums
sect3.para: To play a track, either select the track and press the 'Play' button on the toolbar, or simply double-click on the track (or Album or Artist) to start playing.

The 'player' area provides access to details about the currently playing track. When a track is not being played, this area shows no information. When 'Play' is selected, the track name is displayed, and underneath, the artist and the album names. A tracker is also displays, showing the progress of the playing.
The arrow keys can be used to Fast-Forward or Rewind the playing track

tip.para: Clicking on the artist or album name (where they are underlined) will load the appropriate 'allmusic.com' page.

sect3.title: Shuffle
sect3.para: When this button is pressed, the tracks in the browser are played in 'random' order.

sect3.title: Repeat
sect3.para: When this button is pressed, when the last track in the browser is played, the list is repeated from the beginning.

sect3.title: Next/Previous
sect3.para: These buttons can be used to skip between tracks whilst playing. The previous button will restart the song if it's been playing for a while, or skip to previous if at the start of a track (within first 2 seconds).

sect3.title: Volume Control
sect3.para: The volume of playback can be adjusted using the volume slider in the top right hand of the view. Sliding the to the right will increase the volume, whilst to the left will reduce it. The loudspeaker icon will change to indicate the relative volume.

note.para: To mute the sound, click on the loudspeaker icon, and to restore the muted sound, do likewise.

sect2.title: The Library
sect2.para: The &application; library is an organized view of all your music files. You can browse the library by artist or by album. Once you have added a song to your library you can play it directly or add it to a group to be played as part of a playlist.

warning.para: The library is located in the .gnome/rhythmbox directory in your home directory. It is unique for each user on your system.
If you delete or move this directory a new, empty library will be created when the application is next opened.

sect3.title: Adding Songs
Deleting Songs
sect3.para: To delete songs from the library, simply select the song and either open the Edit menu and choose the Delete item or press the Delete key. Once the last entry of an album (or artist) is deleted, the appropriate entry is also deleted from the album (or artist view).

sect3.title: Using the Browser
sect3.para: The Browser allows the library to be easily browsed, showing the artist, then albumn of the current track. It is not shown when viewing a group

When started, the browser defaults to viewing all artists, and all tracks. Selecting an individual artist will change the Album list to show all albums by this artist, and the track list changes to show all tracks for these albums. Selecting an album will change the track list to show only the contents of this album.

sect3.title: Properties
sect3.para: Use the Edit menu and choose Properties item to view the properties of a particular track. (CtrlP will do the same thing). The dialog is divided into 2 sections, the first shows the basic details of the entry.
The 'Advanced' section of the dialog shows more detailed information about the file itself and its encoding. It also shows the associated with the file.

sect3.title: Searching
sect3.para: To search the &application; library for a particular word or phrase, type into the search field, and the view will show all the entries that have the search criteria will be shown the in the tracks list.

sect2.title: Statistics
sect2.para: &application; will maintain statistics on the use of the library. It automatically records the number of plays, the last played date and allows you to rating each track. You can access this information through columns in the song list that you can add via the dialog.

sect3.title: Ratings
sect3.para: This allows each song in the library to be rated on a scale of 1 to 5 stars. To rate a song, click in the 'Rating' column. Click in different parts of the column to set the required rating.

sect3.title: Number of plays
sect3.para: Each time a track has completed playing, its play count is incremented by 1. This will allow the most popular songs in the library to be easily identified.

sect3.title: Last played time
sect3.para: When the play count is incremented, the last played time is also recorded.

sect2.title: Groups
sect2.para: A group is a 'playlist' of songs that has been created in &application;. It might consist of a groups of songs of a particular 'genre', a specific group of artists, or even songs that are of a particular 'mood'.
To display a group, simply click on the required group, and the library display will change to show the contents.

sect3.title: Adding Songs
sect3.para: To create a group use one of the following methods:

itemizedlist.listitem: Drag a 'track', 'album' or 'artist' to the side pane. When the group is created, it will default to either the name of the artist (when dropping an artist), the name of the album (when an album), or when a track is dropped, a dialog is displayed, prompting for the name of the group (which is by default named 'Untitled').

Open the Organize menu and choose the New Group item (CtrlN will do the same thing). Again a dialog is displayed prompting for a name, and if the 'Add selected track' option box is ticked, then any selected tracks will be added to the group.

sect3.para: To add a song, album or artist to an already existing group just drag and drop it from the library to the group's icon in the side pane.

sect3.title: Deleting Songs
sect3.para: To delete songs from a group, simply select the song and either open the Edit menu and choose the Delete item or press the Deletekey.

sect3.title: Modifying a Group
sect3.para: Right click on a group to display the group menu. This will allow the renaming and deletion of the group. Selecting the Rename will display a prompt for the new name of the group (pressing F2 when a group is selected will do the same). Selecting the Delete will delete the group (note that the 'content' of the group is not removed from the library, just the 'playlist'.

sect2.title: Panel Applet
sect2.para: The Notification Area is a Gnome feature that allows applications to add a small icon to the panel while the program is running. &application; adds it's icon to the notification area and this allows you to control &application; from your tray.
Using the &application; icon in the notification area, the following commands can be sent to the application:

itemizedlist.listitem: Play / Pause — Play or Pause the currently selected song. This item changes depending on whether a song is playing or not.
Previous — Skip to previous song in playlist.
Next — Skip to next song in playlist.
Show Window — choose whether or not the &application; window is visible or not.

sect2.title: Preferences
sect2.para: Using the preferences dialog you can customize how you want &application; to look.

sect3.title: Appearance
sect3.para: This section of dialog the allows you to select which parts of the application will be displayed.

sect3.title: Columns
sect3.para: This section of the dialog allows you to select which columns are displayed in the song list.

sect2.title: Toolbar editing
sect2.para: The Toolbar editor lets you add, remove and re-order buttons on the &application; toolbar.
